ovdesc.p: This is a live file which will maintain information for all the reportable accounts and this gets updated on the date of report extraction.

desc.p: The ID will be the reportable customer ID concatenated with the date on which the extract is performed.
Customer number from the ID
Date on which the base file is updated.
Year to which the base data pertains to. The field will be taken from the ID.
INDIVIDUAL or ORGANISATION based on whether the client is an individual or a legal entity.
The field will be updated from CUSTOMER record (first name).
The field will be updated from CUSTOMER record (last name)
The field will be updated from CUSTOMER record.
The field will be updated from CUSTOMER (STREET) or DE.ADDRESS (STREET ADDRESS) record based on FATCA REPORTING PARAMETER setting.
The field is a multi-value field which will be updated from the field ADDRESS in CUSTOMER record
The field will be updated from CUSTOMER or DE.ADDRESS record (TOWN COUNTRY)
The field will be updated from CUSTOMER or DE.ADDRESS record (POST CODE).
This field is used to specify whether the address of the owner type has to be from CUSTOMER, FCSI or DE.ADDRESS
Allowed values are CUSTOMER, FCSI or DE.ADDRESS.
The field is the country sub entity updated from field in CUSTOMER or DE.ADDRESS record based on the reporting parameter setting.
The field will be updated from CUSTOMER or DE.ADDRESS record (COUNTRY).

The field will be updated from FATCA CUSTOMER SUPPLEMENTARY INFO (FCSI) record. If GIIN is blank then value is updated from the field FORM.TYPE which is set as document.
The field will be updated from FATCA CUSTOMER SUPPLEMENTARY INFO (FCSI) record.
The field will be updated from FATCA CUSTOMER SUPPLEMENTARY INFO (FCSI) record.
The field will be updated for clients with FATCA STATUS equal to the Owner Report Status in FATCA reporting parameter.
Customer ID or Unique ID from FCSI will be updated. Fields from Relation Customer to Rel FATCA STATUS will be associated multi-value fields
The field will be the relation code for the associated Related Customer. It will be blank if relationship details are being updated from FCSI.
The field will be the name of the related customer. It will be the first name if the first name is present else it will be the holder name.
The field will be the last name updated from FATCA CUSTOMER SUPPLEMENTARY INFO.
The field will be updated from FCSI record for the related customer.
The field will be updated from FCSI record (identified based on FATCA.ROLE.TYPE).

Second line of address if updated from FCSI record
ADDRESS field if updated from CUSTOMER record.

Third line of address if updated from FCSI record
TOWN.COUNTRY field if updated from CUSTOMER record
TOWN.COUNTY field if updated from DE.ADDRESS record.

POST.CODE field if updated from CUSTOMER record

Based on the list of client types allowed in FCSI,for the client types Individual, Small Account and High Value account, will be updated as 'EXISTING'
if Customer Since (field in Customer) field is blank or less than 1st July 2014 and for rest, if less than 1st Jan 2015.
If condtion not satisfied, update as 'NEW'.
Based on the request From FATCA.XML.REQUEST Will be updated as FATCA1 -NEW, FATCA2- CORRECTION,FATCA3-VOID,FATCA4-AMEND.
The field will be updated from the field LOCAL.COUNTRY in COMPANY record.
The field will be same as the TRANS.COUNTRY if status field from FATCA.PARAMETER equals IGA1 otherwise updated as US.
Time of the request for generating xml will be updated.
The field will be updated from the field COMPANY.NAME in COMPANY record.
This is a multi-value field which will be updated from the field NAME.ADDRESS in COMPANY record.
The field will be updated from the field EIN in FATCA.PARAMETER record.
The field will be updated as FATCA.TAX.BASE.ID.SEQ.NO (seq.no will be 1 for the new record).
The field is used for updating the amended message reference.
This data element identifies an entity account holder or payee that is: (1) an owner documented FI with specified US owner(s);
(2) a passive NFFE with substantial or controlling US owner(s); (3) a nonparticipating FFI; or (4) a Specified US person.
FATCA101 – If the FATCA STATUS of the entity is Owner Documented FI (identified based on Status Type and FATCA STATUS in FATCA Reporting Parameter)
FATCA102 – If the FATCA STATUS of the entity is Passive NFFE (identified based on Status Type and FATCA STATUS in FATCA Reporting Parameter)
FATCA103 – If the FATCA STATUS of the entity is Non-Participating FFI (identified based on Status Type and FATCA STATUS in FATCA Reporting Parameter)
FATCA104 – If the FATCA STATUS in the base record is same as SPEC_US_Person status in FATCA REPORTING PARAMETER.
This is part of the multivalue set which start from the field "Account".
The value in this field will be in the format (Payment.Type in FATCA.REPORTING.PARAMETER- Txn.Date) Eg: DEP.INTEREST-20091223.
This is part of the multivalue set which start from the field "Account".
The field contains the amount of payment.It is updated from the INT.MOVEMENT record based on the transaction code defined in REPORTING.PARAMETER
This is part of the multivalue set which start from the field "Account".
The field contains the amount of payment in US dollars
This is part of the multivalue set which start from the field "Account".
The field contains the payment type to be reported in FATCA XML report.
This is part of the multivalue set which start from the field "Account".
The field contains the currency to be reported in FATCA XML report.
This is part of the multivalue set which start from the field "Account".
The field contains the amount to be reported in FATCA XML report.
This is part of the multivalue set which start from the field "Account".
The field contains the amount in US dollars to be reported in FATCA XML report.
